author: Reuters Editorial
title: Swiss stocks - Factors to watch on March 2
text:
ZURICH, March 2 (Reuters) - The Swiss blue-chip SMI was seen opening 0.7 percent lower at 8,727 points on Friday, according to premarket indications by bank Julius Baer .
Here are some of the main factors that may affect Swiss stocks:
LAFARGEHOLCIM LafargeHolcim’s new chief executive laid out his plan to revamp the world’s biggest cement group by growing faster than the overall market and chopping costs. The new five-year strategy targets annual sales growth of 3 to 5 percent, recurring EBITDA growth of at least 5 percent, improvement in free cash flow to over 40 percent of EBITDA, and boosting the return on invested capital to more than 8 percent.
Shares indicated down 2.1 percent.
